November 28th‒ December 2nd, 2016, Rome, Italy

GeoNode Summit 2016

Join the growing opensource GIS commmunity for GeoNode Summit 2016 from November 28, 2016 to December 2, 2016 in beautiful Rome, Italy. All are welcome to attend; whether you are new to opensource GIS or a GeoNode expert. Workshops will provide a collaborative space to learn new technologies and workflows. The Summit is kindly hosted by the WFP Emergency Preparedness and Support Response Division. The registration deadline is November 13, 2016 23:59 UTC.

Register (closed) Logistics, Hotels, etc. What is GeoNode?

GeoNode Community

Join GIS Analysts, Decision Makers, Developers, Data Scientists, and more.

Open Source Software

Developing in the open from Day 1. Open source from database to web client.

Modern GIS

Integrating the latest advances in open source GIS, including OpenLayers 3, Tegola, and much more.

GeoNode Trainings & Documentation

Highlights

  • November 29

    Workshops

    Join a workshop for focused discussion on a topic, including desktop integration, DevOps, security, big data, and more. http://summit.geonode.org/workshops

  • November 30

    Presentations

    Community members will present use cases for GeoNode, past successes or failures, and plans for the future.

  • December 01

    Roadmapping

    Join us to discuss current gaps and operational requirements for GeoNode. We’ll also identify and coalesce ideas for future enhancements to the platform and ecosystem.

GeoNode Summit 2016 Code of Conduct: Professional ideas and information are exchanged most effectively at the Summit in an atmosphere free of abuse or harassment and characterized by courtesy and respect. To that end, the organizers expects all individuals who attend to conduct themselves in a manner that establishes an atmosphere free from discriminatory practices.
